title: Curt Schilling 'defends' Milo Yiannopoulos, later apologizes
text:
Curt Schilling appears to defend Milo Yiannopoulos, updates he was unaware of pedophilia comments Curt Schilling 'defends' Milo Yiannopoulos, later apologizes NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Monday, February 20, 2017, 9:16 PM 
Curt Schilling was briefly at it again on Twitter Monday night, but this time admitted he lost control of his fastball. 
The former Red Sox pitcher appeared to come to the defense of fellow Breitbart employee Milo Yiannopoulos, who recently made comments which condoned sexual relations with young boys , before taking it all back. 
Yiannopolous’ recent comments resulted in losing his speaking gig at the Conservative Political Action Conference and also cost him a book deal with publisher Simon & Schuster. Curt Schilling backs off his defense of Milo Yiannopoulos. (Steven Senne/AP) 
Milo Yiannopoulos disinvited from CPAC after pedophilia comments 
“Let me see if I have this right. @lenadunham child molestor Woody Allen, sex with a minor, Roman Polanski, rapist, But Milo is the problem?” he tweeted. Let me see if I have this right. @lenadunham child molestor Woody Allen, sex with a minor, Roman Polanski, rapist, But Milo is the problem? — Curt Schilling (@gehrig38) February 21, 2017 
After going back and forth with people on Twitter for about half an hour, Schilling suddenly decided to plead ignorance, claiming he had not heard the recent audio of Yiannopolous’ comments and eventually apologized. 
“UPDATE! I had NO idea of the video/audio of Milo's interview which he defends and hides the identity of pedophiles. There's no circumstance in any setting ever where protection of a molester is appropriate and IMO legal? But I apologize if it appeared in any way I was ‘defending” that sort of commentary. I’ll accept any and all abuse thrown my way for not thoroughly going through ALL the material before responding,” he said over three different tweets. UPDATE! I had NO idea of the video/audio of Milo's interview which he defends and hides the identity of pedophiles. But I apologize if it appeared in any way I was 'defending" — Curt Schilling (@gehrig38) February 21, 2017 that sort of commentary. I'll accept any and all abuse thrown my way for not thoroughly going through ALL the material before responding. — Curt Schilling (@gehrig38) February 21, 2017 
Schilling reacting on Twitter without doing his due diligence should not come as a surprise. 
Just last month he got into a Twitter beef with a fake Sidney Ponson account, after it trolled him for not getting into the Hall of Fame. 
At least this time Schilling was able to admit his mistake. Tags:
